result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Joshua S Scanlon
Current: PO Box 938, Oak Hill Correctional Institution, #589531, Oregon, WI 53575 United States  (Effective: 03-27-2017)
Prior: N6309 Cty Rd Q, Knapp, WI 54749

Defendant Joshua Scott Scanlon in court with attorney Ashley J. Morse.  Defendant Joshua Scott Scanlon in custody.  Daniel Joseph Tolan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  JB-clerk 2:11pm     CASES: 10CF240, 11CF99, 14CF13, 14CF17. SAR: 10CF240 - CT goes over cc/penalties. CT 4-13 DRI, 11CF99 - CT goes over cc/penalties, 14CF17 - CT goes over cc/penalties - CT 2 DRI, 14CF13 both counts DRI. Waiver of PSI in 14CF17 case. State - no errors in PSI. Atty Chapman gives correction. Compliance w/VR. State gives argument. Atty Chapman gives argument. 

10CF240: CT 1 - 1 1/2yrs IC and 2yrs ES concurrent with count 2; CT 2 - 3yrs IC and 3yrs ES;  CT 3 - 3yrs IC and 3yrs ES concurrent with count 1 and count 2 -all counts consecutive to 14CF17; sent credit of 786 days. 

11CF99: 6 yrs - 3yrs IC and 3yrs ES consecutive to 14CF17 and consecutive to 10CF240;

14CF13: DRI. 

14CF17: CT 1 - 3 1/2 yrs - 1 1/2 IC, 1 1/2 ES - consecutive to 10CF140 and consecutive to 11CF99, no earned release, eligible for chall inc program, $290.60 fine/costs; $300.00 DNA surcharge - no DNA sample; costs to be paid out of prison wages

Rest has been established - j/s with co-defendants (Eric Wood, Patrick Tourville, Richard Tallen Jr) - paid out of prison wages. 
No firearms, no voting, no body armor, no public office, if not US citizen can be deported.

Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 29, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

CASES: 10CF240, 11CF99, 14CF13, 14CF17  Defendant Joshua Scott Scanlon in court with attorney Daniel J. Chapman.  Defendant Joshua Scott Scanlon in custody.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CT- not enough time on calendar this morning, reschedules.  

DA's to file amended info.   14CF17: Def enters plea of G to Ct 1 w/o repeater.  State capped at probation. CT accepts plea, finds G, enters JOC, dismisses Ct 2 w/pred w/o costs, DRI 14CF13. 

Cannot vote or hold public office, cannot possess firearms or body armor.  will owe a DNA surcharge. Counsel waives PSI. CT- all matters to be sentenced at same time. Parties stipulate $350 restitution to Mr Porter. DA's office to follow up with other restitution requests.  bonds cont. 9:59am adj.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for August 29, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
from Atty D Chapman to Judge re: plea and sentencing

Preliminary hearing on April 14, 2014 at 10:45 am.
Not to possess or use drugs or drug paraphernalia.  May not possess or use firearms.  May not care for animals.
